orig_text: This part MUST be included (contrary to [REPORT])
correct_text:
This part MUST be included if the entity creating the report has 
received the message.
notes: Reports can be created from info collected in SMTP transactions that don't accept a message, a scenario we didn't consider when we wrote this section.

orig_text:
--part1_13d.2e68ed54_boundary
   Content-Type: message/rfc822
   Content-Disposition: inline

   From: <somespammer@example.net>
   Received: from mailserver.example.net (mailserver.example.net
        [192.0.2.1]) by example.com with ESMTP id M63d4137594e46;
        Thu, 08 Mar 2005 14:00:00 -0400

   To: <Undisclosed Recipients>
   Subject: Earn money
correct_text:
--part1_13d.2e68ed54_boundary
   Content-Type: message/rfc822
   Content-Disposition: inline

   From: <somespammer@example.net>
   Received: from mailserver.example.net (mailserver.example.net
        [192.0.2.1]) by example.com with ESMTP id M63d4137594e46;
        Thu, 08 Mar 2005 14:00:00 -0400
   To: <Undisclosed Recipients>
   Subject: Earn money
notes: In the second example report, there is an empty line in the middle of the headers section of the quoted rfc822 message.  This seems wrong.
The TLD of the spammer's emailaddress should be `.net` as in the rest of the example.
